title: 107_hr2252
content: The Act titled "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of conduit contribution ban. Increase in Civil Money Penalty and Criminal Penalty for violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, specifically section 320, with penalties not less than 300 percent of the amount involved and not more than $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount involved. The amendment increases the criminal penalty for violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to a fine of not less than 300 percent of the amount involved, imprisonment for up to 2 years, or both. The fine shall not exceed $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount involved. The United States Sentencing Commission is tasked with issuing guidelines for these penalties. The United States Sentencing Commission is required to establish guidelines for penalties related to violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, taking into account the varying amounts of contributions involved. Additionally, they must provide Congress with an explanation of any guidelines created or modified. The United States Sentencing Commission must establish guidelines for penalties related to violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 within 90 days of the enactment of the Act. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to section 309(d)(1)(A) of the Act. Mandatory referral to the Attorney General is required under section 309(a)(5)(C). The amendments made by this section extend the statute of limitations for violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to 5 years. Violations occurring after the enactment of this Act will be referred to the Attorney General. The extension of the ban on foreign contributions to all campaign-related disbursements under the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 includes prohibiting disbursements by foreign nationals to political committees and for independent expenditures. Effective immediately for disbursements made after the enactment of this Act.
